dataset.title: Dataset: Carbon accumulation rates in a salt marsh over the past two millennia
dataset.abstract: High rates of carbon burial observed in wetland sediments have garnered attention as a potential “natural fix” to reduce the concentration of carbon dioxide (CO2) in Earth’s atmosphere. A carbon accumulation rate (CAR) can be determined through various methods that integrate a carbon stock over different time periods, ranging from decades to millennia. Our goal was to assess how CAR changed over the lifespan of a salt marsh. We applied a geochronology to a series of salt marsh cores using both 14C and 210Pb markers to calculate CARs that were integrated between 35 to 2,460 years before present. CAR was 39 g C m-2 y-1 when integrated over millennia, but was upwards of 148 g C m-2 y-1 for the past century. We present additional evidence to account for this variability by linking it to changes in relative sea-level rise (RSLR), where higher rates of RSLR were associated with higher CARs. Thus, the true CAR calculated for a wetland should integrate recent timescales that capture the influence of contemporary RSLR, but must also omit recently deposited labile organic carbon that will ultimately decompose. Therefore, caution should be exercised not to utilize a CAR calculated over inappropriate time scales as a current assessment or forecasting tool for the climate change mitigation potential of a wetland.
dataset.intellectualRights: This dataset is listed under a Creative Commons BY 4.0 and can be used with attribution. https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/

attribute.attributeDefinition: Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's or 'et al.' if more than three, then publication year spearated by underscores. See worksCited.bib for more detail.
Code indicating what type of device was used to collect soil depth profiles.

codeDefinition.definition: A half cylinder coring device with the coring section sealed off by a fin attached to a rotating pivot point
Aluminum corer with 7 cm diameter

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating whether live roots were included or excluded from carbon assessments.

codeDefinition.definition: Roots and rhizomes were included in dry bulk density and or organic matter and carbon measurements

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating whether or not sediment was sieved prior to carbon measurements.

codeDefinition.definition: Sediment was not sieved prior to analysis for organics.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating how the authors qualified or quantified compaction of the core.

codeDefinition.definition: Authors specified that the coring device's design minimized compaction

attribute.attributeDefinition: Temperature at which samples were dried to measure dry bulk density. This can include either samples that were freeze dried or oven dried.
Any notable codes regarding how the authors quantified dry bulk density.

codeDefinition.definition: Bulk density methodology did not specify drying temperature or length, only that samples were dried to a constant mass

attribute.attributeDefinition: Temperature at which samples were combusted to estimate fraction organic matter.
Time over which samples were combusted to estimate fraction organic matter.
Common codes regarding loss on ignition methodology.

codeDefinition.definition: Loss on ignition time recorded herein is an approximate estimate

attribute.attributeDefinition: Whether or not carbonates were removed prior to calculating fraction organic carbon.

codeDefinition.definition: Carbonates were removed before measuring organic carbon.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The method used to remove carbonates prior to measuring fraction carbon.

codeDefinition.definition: Carbonates were removed using direct application of dilute acid

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating the method for which fraction carbon was measured or modeled (Note: regression based models are permitted, but the use of the Bemmelen factor [0.58 gOC gOM-1] is discouraged).

codeDefinition.definition: Each sample presented was measured using Elemental Analysis

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating whether fraction_carbon refers to organic or total carbon.

codeDefinition.definition: Author specified that fraction carbon measurements were of organic carbon

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating the method used for determining lead 210 activity.

codeDefinition.definition: Alpha counting method used

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating the mass or accretion rate used in the excess_pb_210_model

codeDefinition.definition: Excess 210Pb modeled using mass accumulation rate

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating the model used to estimate excess lead 210.

codeDefinition.definition: Constant flux constant sedimentation model used.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating the method used for determining radiocarbon activity.

codeDefinition.definition: Accelerator mass spectroscopy used

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating the reference or 0 year of the age depth model.

codeDefinition.definition: Year zero is set as the core's collection year.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's or 'et al.' if more than three, then publication year spearated by underscores. See worksCited.bib for more detail.
Site identification code unique to each study.
Core identification code unique to each site.
Date of core collection.
Any other relevant submitter generated notes on how cores were collected.
Positional latitude of the core in decimal degree WGS84.
Positional longitude of the core in decimal degree WGS84.
Code indicating how latitude and longitude were determined.

codeDefinition.definition: Any other technique resulting in positional error < 1 meter

attribute.attributeDefinition: Any relevant submitter generated notes on how latitude and longitude were determined.
Surface elevation of the core relative to defined datum.

The datum relative to which the core elevation was measured against (For a complete list of datum names and aliases please refer to the ISO Geodedic Registry https://iso.registry.bespire.eu/register/geodetic/VerticalDatum).

codeDefinition.definition: A gravity-based geodetic datum, North American Vertical Datum of 1988

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating how elevation was determined

codeDefinition.definition: Any other technique resulting in positional error < 5 cm of random error

attribute.attributeDefinition: Any relevant submitter generated notes on how elevation was determined

Code based on submitter field observation or measurement indicating average annual salinity (Note: Palustrine and freshwater should only include tidal wetlands, or wetlands that are potentially/formerly tidal but artificially freshened due to artificial tidal restrictions).

codeDefinition.definition: 5-35 parts per thousand salinity (ppt) according to the coastal change analysis program
0.5-35 ppt according to most definitions

attribute.attributeDefinition: Indicate whether salinity_class was determined using a field observation or a measurement

codeDefinition.definition: Salinity observed from local instrument.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code based on submitter field observations or measurement indicating dominant wetland vegetation type.

codeDefinition.definition: Describes wetlands dominated by persistent emergent vascular plants

attribute.attributeDefinition: Indicate whether vegetation_class was determined using a field observation or a measurement

codeDefinition.definition: Vegetation measured by counts or plots.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Any relevant submitter generated notes on how vegetation_class and dominant_species were determined.
Code based on submitter field observation or measurement indicating how often the coring location is inundated.

codeDefinition.definition: Study-specific definition of an elevation in the relative middle of the tidal frame, typically defined by vegetation type

attribute.attributeDefinition: Indicate whether inundation_class was determined using a field observation or a measurement

codeDefinition.definition: Inundation class assessed from elevation and nearby tide gauge or other similar method.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Any relevant submitter generated notes on how inundation was determined
Indicated whether or not the coring team believes they recovered a full sediment profile, down to bedrock, or other non-marsh interface.

codeDefinition.code: core depth limited by length of corer
codeDefinition.definition: The total depth of the core was limited by the length of the coring device
Authors report that the depth of the core represents the depth of the wetland soil deposit

attribute.attributeDefinition: Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's or 'et al.' if more than three, then publication year spearated by underscores. See worksCited.bib for more detail.
Site identification code unique to each study.
Core identification code unique to each site.
Minimum depth of a sampling increment.
Maximum depth of a sampling increment.
Dry mass per unit volume of a soil sample. This does not include ash free bulk density.
Mass of organic matter relative to sample dry mass. Ash free bulk density should not be used here but should be expressed as a loss on ignition fraction.
Measured mass of carbon relative to sample dry mass.
Modeled mass of carbon relative to sample dry mass.
Total radioactivity counts per unit dry weight for excess lead 210 (210Pb).
Standard error associated with total_pb210_activity
Excess radioactivity counts per unit dry weight for excess lead 210 (210Pb).
Standard error associated with excess_pb210_activity
Radiocarbon age as estimated from AMS measurements.
Estimated uncertainty in c14_age.
Description of the material selected for radiocarbon (14C) dating.
Any relevant submitter generated notes on 14C dating process.
The isotopic signature of 13C. This is oftentimes measured along with c14_age and can be useful for analyzing carbon lability and provenance.
Most likely, median, or mean age of the depth interval from submitter generated age depth model.
Standard error associated with age depth model
Mass depth

unit.name: disintegrationsPerMinutePerGram
unit.description: disintegrations per minute per gram is a measure of the activity of the source of radioactivity

unit.name: gramsPerSquareCentimeter
unit.description: grams per square meter per year
